title: ISIS Poses a Growing Threat to New Taliban Government in Afghanistan
content: The Taliban takeover was supposed to bring an end to war, the new government promised. But a growing insurgency is upending security and raising alarms for the international community.

more_info.byline: By Victor J. Blue, Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Christina Goldbaum
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

title: From BTS to ‘Squid Game’: How South Korea Became a Cultural Juggernaut
content: The country was once largely known for cars and smartphones, but a global audience has become mesmerized by its entertainment, and creators say success didn’t happen overnight.

title: Ethiopia’s Leader Vows to ‘Bury This Enemy,’ Even as Rebels Advance
content: A United Nations report, released as Tigrayan rebels near the capital, documents atrocities on all sides in a year-old civil war.

des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

title: Video Footage Showed at Least 1 Child Near Site Minutes Before Drone Strike in Kabul
content: An investigation of the Aug. 29 airstrike, which mistakenly killed 10 civilians, including seven children, did not recommend any disciplinary action.

more_info.byline: By Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

title: The U.S. blacklists the NSO Group, an Israeli spyware firm.
content: NSO and three other companies were added to a list that blocks foreign companies from buying certain types of sensitive American technology without a license.

title: Weapons Tracing Study Implicates Russia in Ukraine Conflict
content: One of the most comprehensive studies to date of weaponry in the war in Ukraine shows a panoply of Russian-supplied arms that has helped fuel the war.

title: Torn From Parents in the Belgian Congo, Women Seek Reparations
content: Belgium has apologized for the kidnapping and deportation of thousands of mixed-race children under its colonial rule. Survivors say that reparations should be the next step.

title: A Chinese Tennis Star Accuses a Former Top Leader of Sexual Assault
content: Peng Shuai’s accusation against Zhang Gaoli takes the country’s budding #MeToo movement to the top echelons of the Communist Party for the first time.

title: How Does The New York Times Cover International News? We Asked Our Reporters.
‘My Name Is Cleo’: Girl, 4, Is Found 18 Days After Vanishing From Campsite
content: Cleo Smith disappeared one night while camping with her family in a remote area of Australia. She was found “alive and well” in a locked house, and a man was detained.

title: The W.H.O. grants Covaxin, a Covid vaccine developed in India, emergency authorization.
content: The vaccine is the eighth coronavirus vaccine to receive the global health body’s green light.

more_info.byline: By Sameer Yasir and Hari Kumar

title: Damon Galgut Wins Booker Prize for ‘The Promise’
content: The novelist, shortlisted for two of his previous books, received one of the world’s most prestigious literary awards for his cutting depiction of a white family in post-apartheid South Africa.

title: Shutting Down Historical Debate, China Makes It a Crime to Mock Heroes
content: Under a new law, China has zealously prosecuted even the perceived slander of Communist figures, broadening Xi Jinping’s campaign to dominate party orthodoxy.

title: Why Is Ethiopia at War With Itself?
content: The civil war has shifted dramatically since Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed began a military campaign in the Tigray region a year ago. With Tigrayan fighters advancing toward the capital, Ethiopia is at risk of collapse.

more_info.byline: By Declan Walsh and Abdi Latif Dahir

title: 18 countries will promise to phase out coal, according to a leaked document.
content: The countries, banks and other organizations that make up a new coalition will commit to ending all investment in new coal power generation domestically and internationally.

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: With scant vaccine supplies, the W.H.O. presses Latin America and the Caribbean to hold off on boosters.
content: Sufficient shipments of vaccines have been slow to reach many countries in the region and economic inequalities are complicating matters.

title: Mayor Eric Garcetti of Los Angeles tests positive for the virus.
content: Mr. Garcetti’s office said the mayor, who is in Scotland for a conference on climate change, was feeling good and had been fully vaccinated.

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: ‘The planet is in serious trouble,’ says Scotland’s leader, Nicola Sturgeon.
content: The leader of the nation hosting COP26 said she hoped that a century from now, people will look back and “describe Glasgow as the place which really took the correct fork in the road for our planet.”

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Your Thursday Briefing
content: Election losses leave U.S. Democrats reeling.

title: Greece tightens restrictions on the unvaccinated as virus cases spike.
content: The restrictions start Saturday and target unvaccinated people, said the country’s health minister, Thanos Plevris.

title: European Steel Plan Shows Biden’s Bid to Merge Climate and Trade Policy
content: A potential agreement on steel trade provides the clearest look yet at how the Biden administration plans to implement a trade policy that is both protectionist and progressive

title: Satellite monitoring of emissions from countries and companies ‘changes everything,’ Al Gore says.
content: Real-time checks on where greenhouse gases are being produced may prove a powerful weapon in the fight to cool the earth.

title: Sunao Tsuboi, 96, Dies; Hiroshima Victim Who Lived to Tell His Story
content: After suffering through the agony of the attack and its aftermath, he devoted himself to spreading the message that nuclear weapons should be abolished.

des_facet: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

title: Organizers blame the pandemic as frustrations grow over long waits and other glitches at the climate conference.
content: One veteran of the annual gathering described it as the “poorest planed” to date. A young American activist called it a “hellscape.”

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: A protest outside the main summit venue calls out ‘greenwashing’ by big companies.
content: As the focus of the Glasgow summit turns to funding, protesters call for greater accountability for companies’ climate promises.

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: As deadlines loom, the U.S. military grants few vaccine exemptions.
Australia’s climate pledges fall short, again, critics say.
content: Prime Minister Scott Morrison did not announce any firm plans to move away from the country’s deep investment in fossil fuel production.

more_info.byline: By Daniel Victor and Damien Cave
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Janet Yellen, the Treasury secretary, says the U.S. will help raise $500 million for green bonds.
content: Ms. Yellen said wealthy countries had pledged billions of dollars to tackle climate change, but the real cost is in the trillions.

more_info.byline: By Lisa Friedman and Eshe Nelson
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Duterte vows to punish Philippine officials for slow vaccine delivery.
Virginia Goes Red
content: Republicans had a good election night.

more_info.byline: By David Leonhardt and Ian Prasad Philbrick

title: A new $10.5 billion fund aims to spur green energy projects in poor countries.
content: Its backers say it will jump-start investments in clean energy that would not otherwise draw private investors.

org_facet: Global Energy Alliance for People and Planet

title: Global finance industry says it has $130 trillion to invest in efforts to tackle climate change.
content: The pledge would transform the international financial system, but critics say it falls short on fossil fuels.

more_info.byline: By Liz Alderman and Eshe Nelson
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Governments must create millions of new green jobs, Ban Ki-moon says.
content: His comments come amid rising concern that transitioning to a greener economy could provoke a backlash if the cost falls to low- and middle-income people.

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: South Africa secured $8.5 billion to transition away from coal. It’ll be a test case.
content: Developing nations have long said they need aid from wealthy countries to shift to renewable energy. South Africa may show how that would work in practice.

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Brazil presents itself as part of the solution, but critics see a climate scofflaw.
Your Wednesday Briefing
content: Developments at the COP26 climate summit.

title: With Methane and Forest Deals, Climate Summit Offers Hope After Gloomy Start
content: Agreements to reduce methane gas emissions and protect the world’s forests were reached Tuesday at the U.N.-sponsored meeting, as President Biden chided the leaders of Russia and China for not showing up.

more_info.byline: By Jim Tankersley, Katie Rogers and Lisa Friedman
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
